result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Odilia Garcia

Attorney appears by authorization. j
Atty Crawford requests a new date and offer from State.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:44 AM Defendant Odilia Garcia not in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Odilia Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Atty Crawford requests discovery in this matter and time to talk to the assigned ADA in this matter. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 027110,
Payable Number: 469365,
Receipt Number: 22R 028981,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

08:51 AM Defendant Odilia Garcia in court with Attorney Alexis Garuz for Attorney Paul Crawford.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on June 24, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
